title: Art + History: Silk Roads
description:
During this day-long mini-conference for middle and high school humanities teachers, explore ways in which art can be used as both a primary source for historical inquiry and a tool to build your students’ visual literacy, research strategies, and questions.

Mini-conferences at the Art Institute support interdisciplinary dialogue and collaboration among educators, museum staff, and local experts, inspiring the integration of art across the curriculum.

Teacher mini-conferences feature a distinguished keynote presentation, dynamic sessions led by museum educators, teaching artists, and other professionals, and tested curricular resources.

Registration for this event has closed.

*Lunch is included. Chicago Public School and Big Shoulders Fund School teachers are eligible for waived tuition and reimbursement for substitute teacher costs.

If you have any questions or special needs, please call (312) 443-3719 or email teacherworkshops@artic.edu.
